formattedAddress: 536 E 5th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 536 E 5th St, New York, NY 10009, USA

editorialSummary.text: Contemporary American cooking with Asian influences in a casual space featuring reclaimed materials.

originalText.text: Located in alphabet city an unassuming restaurant, cozy and relaxed yet a sophisticated feel. You can actually hear each other, which is rare in New York, making this a top rec for date spots. Food was absolutely delicious. I don‚Äôt think we had any dishes we didn‚Äôt like. Highlights were kabocha squash, chicken with risotto, and cute little quail. Server‚Äôs recs were solid, no liquor only beer and wine (but they make cocktails from wine/sake).

originalText.text:
Loved the food and ambiance here - it‚Äôs quieter than average so you don‚Äôt have to yell to hear each other and it‚Äôs great for date nights or intimate dinners with family and friends.

They have a small, changing Asian fusion menu and we loved almost all the dishes here with the highlights being:
- snow crab noodles with squash and dashi butter
- heirloom tomato with ‚ÄúTom yum‚Äù seafood and watercress
- deviled eggs made crispy
- fluke (fish) with massaman curry and CORN!!

Definitely highly recommend those. We thought the quail, eggplant, and dessert were just OK. Delicious but nothing special and didn‚Äôt have the wow factor that other dishes had.

Also we enjoyed the complimentary scallion pancake inspired balls at the start of the meal.

Came out to about $95 per person after tax and tip for food and a cocktail.

originalText.text: First time trying a Michelin starred restaurant and had a great time, I had dinner reservations for 9pm but got there at 8:15 and was sat right away because there was room in the restaurant. It's a small intimate place light with warm candles. My partner and I got the snow crab noodles and chicken plus broccoli and rice for sides . Everything was delicious and decadent. Come here for a special night and will not be disappointed.

text.text: First time trying a Michelin starred restaurant and had a great time, I had dinner reservations for 9pm but got there at 8:15 and was sat right away because there was room in the restaurant. Come here for a special night and will not be disappointed.

originalText.text:
Tuome seems like someone tried to open a nice European restaurant but they couldn't stop eating at, and being influenced by, all of the amazing Asian restaurants in the East Village, Lower East Side, and China Town.

The result is an intimate setting where you can have deep convos with old friends and dates without the usual racket of most NYC restaurants, and without the overly stuffy atmosphere found at some Michelin starred places.

While bonding with your dining partner, and sipping wine from a beautifully curated American and European wine list, you get to dine on some of the best dishes from... uh ... China??

Well yeah but not exactly. I hate to say "fusion" but that's what this is -- fusion of minds, bellies, and fusion of thoughts that NYC is maybe the best dining city in the world.

The snow crab noodles (come for the crab stay for the noodles!) is not to be missed. Get the "Pig Out" as well -- little squares of perfectly rendered pork belly -- crispy and unctuous. Splurge on a wine from the Northern Rh√¥ne and drift off to contented bliss.
